intro: Psychotria transiens, commonly known as the transient psychotria, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Psychotria transiens is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
